text:
The present West Coast Park was developed in many phases.
In the 1998 redevelopment, a plan was made to include a Marsh Garden, comprising of a pond, with mud flats and wetland vegetation around it, aiming to provide a sanctuary for both local and migratory birds.
The Marsh Garden, located at the west end of the Park, is hidden from view. As you walk on the Boardwalk to enter the serene Marsh Garden leading to the pond's water edge, you can hear the calls of different birds from above. The viewing deck is quiet and shady. Immerse in it's surrounding vegetations and calm waters, and be mesmerise by it's tranquility.

A small yet an interesting jungle to drop by if you're at West Coast Park. You can see lots of greenery with turtles at the muddy ponds. There are various kinds of trees to look at as well. I would recommend that you visit Marsh Garden during the day when the sky is blue, it will be nicer to take photos and appreciate the nature

Marsh Garden at West Coast Park is a pleasant spot dedicated to preserving Singapore's dwindling natural wetland environment and native flora. The small boardwalk over the marshland provides an enjoyable stroll under the shade, offering a peaceful experience. While there's only one observation point with limited views, the garden adds a nice touch to West Coast Park. Although not spectacular, itâ€™s a charming highlight worth visiting.

Beautiful walk among trees.

Once you start walking you almost forget to be in a busy metropolis and feel like in a jungle. Can hear birds sing and sometimes you can see monitor lizards, squirrels and turtles.

Picturesque and tranquil part of West Coast Park.. the Marsh Garden is a MUST-SEE.. catch sightings of the resident monitor lizards and other fauna. Pictures were taken by my brother... I was just too engrossed, being present in the moment.
